intro: Hieracium furcillatum, commonly known as the forked hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright stems and alternate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers, which bloom in the summer, are yellow and arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. Hieracium furcillatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
